IUj-k81hngHw-dIEV8Om2g.text: This place is amazing!  Such a cool vibe and such awesome folks that work there.  And the food was out of this world delicious.  I decided to them out based on the reviews I've been seeing about them.  My only gripe is that I don't live as close to there as I would like lol.  Still... worth the drive!

GYHECWwl1496o7RXINPQGQ.text: I had the loveliest accidental solo Sunday brunch at Geppetto a month or so ago. I woke up on a blessed weekend off and found myself hankering some pancakes. I was on my way down to the Strip when I realized that I needed cash for where I had in mind, so I parked right in front of Geppetto to stop at the nearby Citizens Bank. For whatever reason, Geppetto felt welcoming right at that moment, so I skipped the ATM and ambled inside. I settled in at a window table and received the friendliest service with a spot-on recommendation for the chicken and Gruyere crepe, which was accompanied by a light mixed greens salad and accented by a spicy Sriracha-based sauce on top. I happily lingered over a book and my coffee (refills for days) as the summer sunshine poured in. Will definitely be back with friends for future Sunday brunches!

YpMamsiBgIs-mWZAQQkHOw.text: Interesting idea to have a crepe restaurant in Pittsburgh, but disappointed after visit. My partner had the "bonjour" which did not blend well and was tasteless. I created my own crepe with avocado, bacon and mozzarella but mostly tasted the clumps of mozzarella that were not melted and the strange taste of the crepe.  The service was slow and unprofessional. We left unhappy with our whole experience.

VI0fMo1Y-DitQ6XGJJoRUw.text: Enough options for vegetarians. Really good challah french toast and the portions aren't overwhelming. Coffee was really good too. The wait staff was very friendly and attentive - the small talk with them wan't forced or awkward. The lighting goes well with the white walls (painted exposed brick rather than the standard red).  I think they might have room for a few bar stools for single diners, but I didn't see any. I was happy to see that they stick to french toast, waffles and crepes without trying to offer too many diner style sides. So much better than a place like Waffles Incaffeinated!

nQB9FkmGrjfbxy5v7nVsKg.text: A fantastic balance of sweet and savory. The sweet comes with the French toast options. One bite of the apple French toast and I was sold. The crepe selection is inventive and savory.  The coffee is amazing even a generic cup is phenomenal. The bathrooms are the real problem styled with stained tiles on the ceiling and smelling of wet dog I would suggest finding other options. The seating is super strange. The bar style kitchen has taken most of the front area and patrons are placed in the back behind the kitchen. The BYOB part did make me very happy. So if that description fits your weekend plans, go with the brunch group and enjoy!

c7T3XGkJP3C9rtzufMd6xw.text: Great little cafe in Lawrenceville. The menu consists of an amazing amount of crepes which are both savory and sweet! They also have quite the selection of challah French toast.  The tiramusu crepe was quite the treat. So delicious and the perfect size for the price. They also serve Turkish coffee! I can't wait to try their other crepe selections!

0wQzpg_TLhSNGY6AKUJbpQ.text: Went here for the first time for brunch today. The store is super cute and cozy, and service was very attentive and friendly. We had to wait about 10 minutes for a table for 2, not bad for 11:30am on a Saturday. I ordered the chicken and gruyere crepe which was really good. The homemade spicy cause was creamy, tangy and delicious. It complemented the caramelized onions and cheese well, and the crepe was just saucy enough to not be dry. I will definitely order it again! My boyfriend got the Love Hate Thing, a savory crepe with turkey, goat cheese avocado and bechamel sauce. He substituted salmon for the turkey. Unfortunately, I think the goat cheese made this crepe too dry, and the bechamel sauce didn't add enough flavor or moisture. Generally, I would stick with gruyere or mozzarella in a crepe anyways, seems like the crumbly cheeses are too dry for crepe fillings. Both came with a good mixed greens side salad. I'd easily give the Chicken and Gruyere 5 stars, but the Love Hate Thing earned 3 stars at the most. You can also make your own crepes, but it seems really pricey to do so since each veggies is about $1.50, each meat is $3, cheese is $2 and sauces are $1 with the base price of each crepe $4. So making my Chicken and Guyere would have been $11.50 instead of $9.50. Also, the Turkish coffee was too watery but the drip coffee was good. Will definitely be back to try more crepes, hopefully saving room for a sweet crepe next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Front of the restaurant. Cozy
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. View from the back
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu2

9WthsTt-3MlOD85OUA4Dcg.text: I visited Geppetto last weekend with my boyfriend. We were happy to get seated right away, since it can be hard to get a table for brunch in Lawrenceville. My boyfriend had the french toast, and added an egg and bacon. I had the salmon crepe and added a dippy egg and bacon. They have pre-made crepes, as well as a make your own crepe, however I found that once I totaled up all of the items for my possible make my own crepe it got pricey, so I decided to go with the pre-made salmon crepe. I was also hoping there would be more options for breakfast style crepes as well, (with eggs in them) however there was only 1 "breakfast crepe" on the menu.   Everyone was very nice there, but I could tell that they are working everything out still with being such a new restaurant. Our food arrived and they seemed to have had a mix up with my boyfriends eggs, or forgotten them, so he had to wait for them to be cooked. It only took a few min, so not a huge deal. My salmon crepe was good, however it was a little dry. It had a cream cheese in it, and I agree with one of the other reviewers on here that said the dry cheeses don't seem to work as well in the crepes, at least without some kind of sauce on top. The dippy egg helped a little. It came with a side salad and I added my side of bacon. I hate to say that the bacon was horrible, but there are some really good butchers around here, so I have to say it. It was super, super thin and greasy. Next time, I would forego adding it on. Some people may like it that way I suppose, but I prefer thick cut bacon, this bacon was falling apart because it was so thin. My boyfriends french toast was good, but he had the same comments about the bacon. My crepe was pretty large as well. My boyfriends french toast was a decent size, but nothing crazy.  We will definitely be back to check it out again, I foresee them working out a few things and overall becoming a nice addition to Lawrenceville.

zlnfWnaGdd-L1uj2jXJywg.text: The environment was very friendly, and the "Love Hate Thing" crepe was to die for. I'm still thinking about it a day later!

yIo5pUinVRMsq2PhigYPmw.text: This place is a great new addition to Lawrenceville! Nice mixture of industrial/ playful decor that makes the place inviting. Had the raspberry and goat cheese French toast, which was absolutely amazing, and my wife had the turkey, avocado, goat cheese crepe, which is also great. Was also impressed with the quality of the potted coffee since I'm usually an espresso only person. Only minor complaint was the amount of bacon we got for $3. Was delicious, just not very much. Overall very pleased, we will return.

p4t2nvUY6aC68yYe-73B5g.text: Geppetto Cafe is a great (but tiny) brunch spot on Butler Street. Their menu includes crepes, waffles, and french toast with a wide variety of topping options, sandwiches,, and salads. The spot is really cute--sort of an eclectic & urban-rustic-chic thing going on.   Their waffles and crepes are both particularly awesome, with plenty of savory and sweet options. If you don't like one of the combinations they have on the menu, you can also build your own. Really like the Super Veg crepe, which is filled with feta cheese, spinach, tomatoes, mushrooms and just a little bit of bechamel sauce. Served with a delicious side salad, it was an awesome brunch choice. Their waffles are dense and sweet, with well-carmelized exterior and chewy interior. Their eggs and bacon are both excellent.  Their coffee options are also delicious and a step above a few other local breakfast spots. But. But. The only "cream" option they serve with your coffee are those awful little coffee creamer cups. I can't think that small pitchers of actual half-and-half would be that much more difficult to serve.  We did have some service issues during early visits where it took quite awhile to get our food, but they seem to be getting better. It's probably wise to assume it will take a bit longer than normal to get your food, though.

5uxSDJDiUxQZf1zSW4DZIg.text: The atmosphere was very laid back and the food was Great! I had the Merry Berry crepe with chai latte and the were delightful!! Lots of berries and super creamy with the whipped cream and Nutella. The only thing I didn't care for was that it was fairly hot in the restaurant.

g6JBIcRLXa3hfOQCjwDZzQ.text: Sam our super-friendly waiter both made and served the food which was creative, delicious, and beautifully presented. Great atmosphere!

tWP2oA92LI_RedQTsPCxMQ.text: The service here was great and since we arrived around 11:00 we were lucky and didn't have to wait.  So why only 3 stars?  It started when we sat down and the chairs are quite literally the most uncomfortable chairs I've ever sat in at a restaurant.  The menu looks great but the fiood is merely average.  The latte and chai latte looked great when served, but the latte was too strong and the chai latte too weak.  I had the Love Hate Thing which was completely overpowered by the turkey, not nearly enough avacado, and actually a rather bland meal.  It's not that the food was bad, I would eat here again, it's just not anything special.  So many good places in Lawrenceville, maybe it's just me, but I don't see why this place is getting so many rave reviews.

NXKkz5828BH11DlL0IPxFw.text: The food was great, We went for breakfast. Service was good with one exception. If you are going on a Saturday, get there by 10:30 am. Food was awesome. Had the french toast with bananas, sweet cream, and a side order of bacon. Clientele are mostly hipsters with a sprinkling of seniors, and famlies. You won't leave hungry. The interior is funky but still having some of the original decor from the 1900"s. On street pay parking.

BWiEAUXqxkbqZBA6g1Jeaw.text: We waited 40 minutes for the food to come out. Then they forgot a whole crepe. Messed up another one. Put in more crepe makers and this place would be much better. The coffee was good but you couldn't get a refill. Also the crepes are awesome. The problem is entirely the service.  --edit Gave this place another shot today. The food is still great and the service improved dramatically. It seems like there is way more staff or maybe the staff just changed and got much better.

OnkJ98lc3bHyzglD4RrdBA.text: This place is a find!!! Puppet masters / puppeteers/ normal people will love the crepes!!!

lSkvlaRiqW6l8bc50dDN6A.text: We went late, around 2pm on a Saturday, and thus were quickly seated. The staff was unusually young. Our French waiter was quite nice and attentive. Brought us coffee and water quickly. The menu was filled with a large variety of delicious looking sweet and savory crepes and French toast. I opted for the ham and gruyere cheese savory crepe with an egg added in for starters. The crepe itself was soft and flavorful, and the honey aioli was the creamy sweet complement that put it over the top. I probably should have stopped there; my stomach even warned me so. But I followed this up with their Banofe crepe, covered with walnuts, bananas and chocolate sauce. This was a sweet overload for someone who hasn't been eating too much sugar in recent months. But all the same it was delicious. These were nearly as good as my crepes at Little Breizh's in Paris.  I wasn't thrilled with my seat as there was a broom closet behind me that the staff occasionally had to enter. But it was a cute place, and the the three staff members we spoke with were all very hospitable. I highly recommend if you're looking for a good creperie.

sjfQfMzLqHTYViKvr9Zifw.text: The food was great! We tried the Troy and Gone Fishin crepes and the Smoked Turkey panini.  The people were friendly, but it took a while to get our food.  It was worth the wait, but a few people who came in way after us were served first. :(.  We'll definitely go back the next time we're in Lawrenceville.

_XCEmHyKx7kfakDVgKW8BA.text: what a pleasant find- stopped for lunch on a monday when most restaurants  are closed. so glad I did. good fresh food, cute little neighborhood place.

r411ykFXpp3gSaSE7lLU7A.text: Ideal brunch spot with friends.   You can tell there's been a lot of thought into decorating the cafe. There are characters resting in the crevices of the wall. There are books hanging from the ceiling. It all creates a very charming and whimsical atmosphere.   We got the Bonjour crepe, the Love Hate Thing crepe, and the Apple Tree French Toast. All the food was SO good!!!!! 5/5!! The presentation wasn't as pretty as I expected but the flavors were bomb!   The only criticism I have is that the avocado in the Love Hate Thing crepe tasted off. I think it had been baked with the crepe. I would have preferred fresh avocado that had not been baked.

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. love Hate Thing Crepe
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bonjour crepe

4GFDNi04-B40BjgReCWm3g.text: I decided to try this cafe today and when walking in the decor of the restaurant is very unique and interesting. The style was like that of an old fashioned diner feel including the front counter when you first walk in where you can see them cook your food.  I went in on a Monday which means we were one of very few in the restaurant, but I could imagine it does get busy.  The food was excellent we tried crepes, french toast, eggs, and bacon. Although for the price you do not get very much food, and I could've eaten more. Aside from that I would recommend this cafe for everyone to try at least once! I for one would go back to try more of their sweet crepes.

X70Ddb6FLRPcfYDkWsNMeQ.text: With amazing reviews my family and I decided to give Geppetto Cafe a shot. There was a little bit of a wait as it was packed and we where a party of 5. Once seated the waitress came right over and took drink orders. The place is nice looking olden style diner look. I looked at the menu and too my surprise I did not see any hash browns or home fries on menu???? I ordered 2 eggs over easy and bacon and toast. Then I asked the waitress for home fries or hash browns or even french fries, She said they did not have any potatoes??? What sort of breakfast place does not have some sort of potato dish???? I was deeply disturbed  as I was looking forward to some home fries. In any case both eggs where over cooked one more than the other . The bacon was ok. The waitress was a bit slow as it was very busy and it took time to get all the food. Then it took even longer to get the check. I personally would not go back as for me the home fries where to breaking point. The service was a bit slow due to the volume of people. The rest of my family ordered other items on the menu and seemed to be happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

zNdlP0snRjx3iVJZsS1hUA.text: A group of 7 of us came in on Sunday at 11. They don't take reservations, so we had to wait. We expected this with such a large group in a small place. They told us we would wait about 45 mins and it was close to spot on.  They don't serve any alcohol, but they allow you to bring it in for a nominal corking fee. We were waiting outside with our sweaty bottles of champagne (it was so hot!!) and one of the servers came out and offered us waters and to refrigerate our champagne. How nice!  Once we sat, our server was extremely accommodating,  getting us cups of ice (some of my friends chose to bring bloody mary's instead of mimosas), spoons, and extra cups. Service was actually fairly quick for us being a larger group too.  I love breakfast, but I normally don't eat out for it because, in my head, I feel like it's so easy to make at home. Now crepes...that's a different story. This place was so good!! Everyone loved their food. It took me the whole 45 min wait to decide what I wanted to eat because everything sounded amazing. I ended up with the Bonjour, which has eggs and brie in a crepe with bacon on top and maple syrup and fruit on the side. So delicious!! They have options of sweet crepes, savoury crepes, waffles, and you can get eggs and bacon with anything. I will definitely come back here so I can try something else!

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bonjour

5NWM0C3YxHgSBb1zrSDQxQ.text: Really good breakfast place! I'm sure they do lunch well also! First impressions are important and here they greet you as you come in the door! We had the crepes for breakfast and they were done to perfection! A little slow on the English but the food more than makes up for any short comings! Definitely a place you would want to try if you're in the area looking for some nice breakfast and lunch options at the same time.

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cool atmosphere!
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Little touches at play here with the heart spoon!
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon Crepe.  .mmmm!

8OhyuMLQ8ccpeC1qtKTdgA.text: A lovely little cafe in Lawrenceville! The decor was super whimsical and the food was great too.  I ordered the merry berry crepe, which was topped with a thick layer of Nutella and covered in a mix of raspberries, blueberries, blackberries and strawberries. This will have to be my go-to brunch spot from now on so I can try out more of their sweet and their savory crepes!

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Merry berry crepe

xmWwFYaEJdE0xX1AyP0eFQ.text: This place is a beautiful hidden gem in the city of Pittsburgh. I'm astounded I didn't find this place sooner. Everything is very whimsical and cozy in here. There is cute serving ware, table clothes and the menu is also very adorable.   The service is a little mediocre. My server was not as warm as the rest of the cafe.   Atmosphere 5/5. It's so beautiful and quaint inside. I really like all the Pinocchio themed decor. The books hanging from the ceiling was also really fun and added even more visual appeal.   The food is 3/5 stars for me. The food is average. Nothing extraordinary to report back. However, I would definitely come back to try one of their waffles. I ordered the universe favorite and it tasted like what I could make at home.   This is definitely one of the cutest cafes I've been to in the city. I was pleased with my experience and highly recommend visiting, just don't expect out of the ordinary food.

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0__zB9VBSnEKl3j3g5AD0A.text: Lovely place for breakfast/brunch. They have very fast and friendly service. It's a small narrow restaurant that is very welcoming with lovely decor. They have a wonderful selection of crepes and panini is as well as salads. They have lots of coffee options and even have ice cream and cones. I ordered the chicken and gruyere cheese crepe with caramelized onions and a spicy sauce. It was so delicious! My only complaint was that the crepe could've been a bit crispier. The caramelized onions made it seem more soggy in texture since it wasn't as crisp as I would have liked. It was still very delicious and I ate all of it. The side salad was crisp and fresh and the dressing was perfect. The portions were great! My husband had a turkey and avocado panini with goat cheese and also left behind a very clean plate. We both had lattes and they came in very cute cups with mini whisks to stir. I felt like I was on vacation in a foreign cafe. Loved the atmosphere and the food. Finished off brunch with an affogato. It could have used more ice cream but it was still delicious.  I can't wait to come back and try something new. They also have an assortment of sweet crepes and waffles I'll have to try next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My adorable latte
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

_4a3VzPtaJQhpofpkkYXZw.text: We've been wanting to come here for breakfast for quite awhile, so when the opportunity to do so on a weekday with less chance of having to wait for a table happened we pounced. It was a Monday around 1130 and we could sit wherever we wanted which was nice. Our server was great, he checked on us throughout the meal and made sure our waters and coffee with refreshed.  We went with an order of the Universe Favorite French toast and the Cheesecake crepes. We both decided that a side of bacon or sausage would have been a good idea to help cut the overall sweetness of each dish, but they were both delicious.   If I ever come back I'd try a savory crepe to change it up.

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Look at the cute whisks for stirring
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheesecake Crepe
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Universe Favorite French Toast

Ahle-Q4GRewM2p0WXG-kHw.text: Their ice cream and latte are delicious, I didn't try out their brunch menu but am excited to return next time. The only downside is probably the noisiness of the space can be a little overwhelming if you plan on having a nice conversation with your friend.

dnjH8a3PE9rLLxdOvlKI9w.text: This cafe was a random Yelp selection for a New Year's Eve morning breakfast with a friend. We easily found street parking and walked into the restaurant mid morning when we were told that we would have a brief wait. As it was rainy and cold, we avoided standing outside, but unfortunately, the inside waiting area wasn't much better. There was a small bench for two to sit which was already occupied. The front part of the restaurant was made awkward and crowded by the fact that a table with two diners was situated up front by the window. My friend stood by the table for a while but then scooted back over to stand in front of the entrance as she felt awkward encroaching on their space as they ate.  We were seated within 10 minutes at a tiny table for two. I was surprised to see half of the restaurant open when we were taken back to our seats, but I guess some of the table needed to be bused. I had noticed some of the Pinocchio decor by the entrance but spotted little children's umbrellas and books hanging from the ceiling with twine after being seated. The books seemed like a unique and fun addition to the decor while the umbrellas seemed a little weird, tacky, and juvenile to me.  We were forgotten for probably 15 minutes until an apologetic waiter made his way over to our table. I selected the Raspberry and Goat Cheese Challah French Toast with a side of eggs. The french toast was delicious, and I loved the sweet yet slightly sour and tangy combo of a tart raspberry compote combined with flavorful goat cheese. It's definitely a decadent combination that I would love to have again.  While I enjoyed the food, the tight space of the restaurant had me feeling claustrophobic by the end of my meal. Normally, I wouldn't have been bothered by the small space, but considering our crowded wait by the front door, being asked to move my chair up a couple times by another diner weaving her baby stroller out of the restaurant, and being surrounded by the arrival of a large shipment as employees scurried around our table with large boxes, I just started feeling like I was out of the way or forgotten about for my entire meal.

NGKIRRb4VyDHYnenD810ZQ.text: Ultra-cute and also very delicious. Perfect spot for crepes in the city. Their flavor combinations are so unique that it is a real struggle to decide what you want! Sweet and savory crepes, waffles, french toast- seriously hard to choose.   I absolutely loved their chai latte. I didn't expect them to make such flavorful drinks. I also had a sip of their lavender tea and it was divine. This time around, I ordered a crepe with nutella and strawberries. Very fresh fruit, completely slathered in nutella, crepe fluffy and yet thin. I really like that they have a make-your-own section. It's great for picky peeps or those with allergies.

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soy chai latte
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bella crepe
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nutella and strawberries crepe

QBGUlfYX4lo7SjAWsHMaWw.text: Best French Toast in Pittsburgh, quite possibly best in the entire United States! This cute little restaurant is quietly tucked along the strip of shops on Butler Street, but don't let it's quiet vintage look fool you, their food has some loud and modern flavors. I ordered the Smores Stuffed French Toast and it was incredible. The nutella was perfectly melted that it combined with the melted marshmallow creating a perfect balance of flavor. The gram crackers sprinkled on top add a great crunchy texture with the soft and melty toast. All the items on the menu sounded delicious, it was very difficult to choose one. And each item was very reasonably priced for the quality and size of food you get.   The atmosphere of the restaurant itself is adorable and feels very home-y. There's local art for sale on the walls, puppets to go with the theme, and vintage decorations all around. The restaurant is very small, so I recommend coming early or after the brunch rush on the weekends. Our wait was only 20mins for the 2 of us, but I can imagine the wait was longer for larger groups. I will definitely be coming back here to try more of their french toast and crepe options.

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Smores French Toast

HA51L6TbhD5B2qXGUzUDxg.text: Wonderful crepes and sandwiches! It's a good way to start your morning. They also have Happy Hour in the afternoon during the weekdays.  I also have a vegan Latte which means I have a substitute for cow milk.  What I like here is the quick, SMART and nice server, even when it was pretty busy. The place is simple but cozy and many seats. The ingredients were fresh and everything came exactly as I ordered. Definitely is a place that I will be back for crepes (even though I'm not crepe fan!) and sandwiches.

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheese and Ham, sandwich with tomato inside (that I asked to add). So delicious!

51engqrE3Ub5hjJOwwq-FQ.text: This cute little cafe will not disappoint. It is a small place that packs a big punch. The walls are covered with local artists work and cool memorabilia. It is known for its creative crepe menu, but has it has other options as well. We had the Merry Berry and Ham and Cheese crepes. They melted in our mouths. We will be returning the next time we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mDZLGAtmalCEkcoIFW87pA.text: My mother in law found this place and Yelp and the pics were so cute we got sucked into the hype and I'm so glad we did. Firstly, the decor is absolutely adorable. The way they used the books on the ceiling is unique and creative. Secondly, beyond the aesthetics, you can get a good cup of coffee here (I am so tired of trying new placed just to get some watered down latte).  Loved my espresso con panna...loved it so much I wanted to try something else and got a pumpkin spice latte to go (can you believe that's the first ever pumpkin spice latte I've ever had in my life? #Basic) I'll be back for the coffee.   I have to be honest though, I didn't enjoy my waffle that much. I tried the raspberry and goat cheese French toast (because those flavors sound like they would be amazing together...and they were) but my actual french toast was SO dry. I don't know if the expectation was that the raspberry would moisten things more but it was like raspberry on sandpaper. My mother in law, however ABSOLUTELY enjoyed her "the universal favorite" french toast. She said it was definitely moist and she would recommend. Ah well, maybe mine was off??  Some of the tables are quite  close together and I think with winter coats it seems like even less space is available for a human body. The service at this place was quick and with a smile (nothing not to love about that)

AVa2315krNkJyLI4cNSqhQ.text: Food was great! Crepes were delicious and melted in the mouth. Not over priced at all. I would definitely go again. The area was just a little too smaller with small tables.

We decided to give this place a try based on the pics that we saw here on Yelp and we are glad we came by.  We ordered the Geppetto Signature and Nutella Classic Crepes.  SUPER GOOD!!!  Service was really good as well.  The atmosphere is unique and fits the bill.  We'll definitely be back!

frG2dY7xKRjQAUUTx6c7sw.text: I love going to Geppetto Cafe. I love the Pinocchio theme, books hanging from the ceiling and decor as well as the great service and food. Some of my husband's and my favorites are the Monte Cristo French toast, House of Crepes, Chicken and Gouda panini, and tiramisu crepes.  We really like the menu and will continue to go back to try something new or eat one of our favorite dishes.

MV1thbuXpw9pmfbndRU45A.text: The decor in this place is amazing! When I told a friend I was coming here he said "oh it must be an Italian place". No, no it's a Pinocchio place! It's decorated as Geppetto's workshop, and half the enjoyment of the meal came from looking around and pointing out random items to each other  I came here for brunch on a Saturday. There was a bit of a wait, but you can give your name and phone number, and then go checkout the movie theater down the street until you get a call. Once we were seated, service was quite fast!  I had the "Bella" crepe, which was filled with portabella mushrooms, and I very much enjoyed it. Their coffee is also quite good, and my friend said that his chai latte was much better than ones he's had elsewhere in Pittsburgh.   Wonderful brunch place! I can't wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bella Crepe
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Don&#39;t forget to look up!
Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So creative!

DOZafGgaOymGYKhv4V2I_Q.text: We were in town visiting relatives for Thanksgiving and we were looking for a place to eat breakfast and my daughter recommended Geppetto Cafe.  What a great experience.  Very eclectic decorations--hanging books above the tables, exposed walls painted white, and other items with  an industrial feel to it.  The restaurant is thin up front and opens in the back a bit.  Our waiter said the weekends are really packed, so plan accordingly.  Their menu is perfect if you like a nice variety.  There are savory and sweet crepes as well as paninis.  While we did not try it, they also have a wide variety of coffee drinks and gelato for dessert.  We tried two different savory crepes, the Ham & Cheese and the Love Hate Thing.  The Ham and cheese, well it had both on it, served with gruyere cheese and a honey aioli.  We added spinach (and they have tons of other choices you an add to any dish or create your own crepe from scratch).  The Love and Hate Thing crepe was smoked turkey, goat cheese and avocado with a Bechamel sauce (Bechamel sauce, also known as white sauce, is made from a white roux and milk.)  Of the two dishes, I have to say that I liked the Ham & Cheese better because of the combination of flavors.  We went the Sunday after Thanksgiving so I might just have been tired for turkey, but I think the goat cheese was a bit overwhelming.    All the savory crepes are served with a side salad which was also yummy.  All table are provided a free bottle of water, other drinks including the aforementioned coffee cost money.  I can't wait to get back to the Burgh to visit this place again.  There are a ton of other crepes to try and maybe a few paninis too.

T5oP46R7tKO9lQQrXoPX3w.text: Not a french taste- like restaurant. The flavors are wat too American. I'd never go again also because the greasy cloud that covers the place makes me feel sick/disgusted right after eating. One more thing I have to say is the owner is a poker face and rude as well...

5RzSGiEviqt4ily2_KinWQ.text: J and I decided to take a stroll through LVille and stopped at this cute place for breakfast.  We loved everything about this place.  Service was quick and everyone was so pleasant.  Our food was banging! J got the Challah French toast with bananas, a side of bacon, and house coffee.  I ordered the make-your-own crepe and filled it with salmon, avocado, tomatoes, spinach, feta cheese, and honey aioli, with a house salad (complimentary with crepes) and peppermint tea.  Everything was so delicious! The atmosphere and decor were great.  We loved the industrial look with the exposed duct work and corrugated sheet steel on the walls.   We will definitely be frequent fliers at this cute spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Geppetto Cafe - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Challah French Toast w/ Bananas &amp; Salmon/Tomato/Spinach/Feta/Avocado/Honey Aioli Crepe

KdjCTS6W8sElc5bLFPKosQ.text: Very nicely decorated cafe. The food and drinks came out very fast and prices are reasonable. Very clean and friendly.  Nice selection of tasty menu items. I will definitely be back.

-wOVS3kw0jUe9eeidHdHtQ.text: Great location, friendly staff, good coffee, fast service, they have Internet too. Don't know what you like but for me these are great for a weekend brunch! I do recommend the paninis. Will go back

P1mvhyJ9zZU8hSlPfNdLYg.text: JUST PERFECT!  what an amazing experience it was! I was just driving by and saw that place and I was starving so I decided to go in, but to be honest I went in not expecting much! but they literally made my day! the food was really fresh and the portion was just the way it's supposed to be! the staff was very friendly and I met the owner guy, he seems like a really good person and made me feel like he's happy to have me there, I definitely will be back,  I'd give them 10 stars if I could,  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

9vJ_x3IifHwKxfzcnl-qkw.text: The kids (9 & 4) and I stopped in for breakfast on Saturday 9/17. The restaurant is cozy, but well laid out and very pleasingly decorated. Our service was friendly, prompt, and accommodating.   We ordered the French toast with blackberries and goat cheese (me), S'mores French toast (oldest), and the Geppetto crepe (youngest). Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their meal, and we all shared! The presentation was excellent! I could tell it was done with care.   There are a few things that were minor child-based inconveniences that I do not feel took away from the overall quality & service. A kids menu and kid-sized portions do not seem to be available (I did not ask, and none were offered). The chairs did not seem to be able to accommodate a booster seat, nor did one seem available (I did not ask). The drinks (both kids got OJ) come in medium-sized glassware. No cups w/lids seemed to be available (again, I did not ask). A little extra parenting awareness was all that was required to handle these things. However, I feel that inclusion of these features (primarily kids menu and cups/lids) would take Geppetto from a great place for parents/kids to an AMAZING place for parents and kids.   All-in-all, this was a superb breakfast experience for me and my minis. We'll definitely be back!!

uhOU1iYsULLOlaQryjlMrA.text: Not only does this place have amazing food, but their style is exactly mine. I love the books hanging from the ceiling, and the earthy yet cozy feel. It's the perfect brunch spot for a rainy fall morning. I ordered the prosciutto crepe, which had gruyere and honey inside it as well. It was the perfect balance of savory and sweet, and the crepe itself was amazing, too! The crepes are light, fluffy, but not greasy. Their coffee is decent as well, and you get nice large cups! I highly recommend checking this place out.

tynUkIjJdgPeJ08kjlBOLQ.text: My friend and I shared the Chicken Gruyere crepe and the Merry berry waffle, both were absolutely amazing, great salad on the side and super friendly service! Good cappuccinos also!

kcXF95_wcvOM_ICPu94VmQ.text: Great brunch place and addition to the Lawrenceville area. I was having my car detail done on an early Saturday morning and stumbled upon this place while walking to the local area library to wait it out. Glad I stopped in. This place has really great breakfast and brunch food, whether it be the waffles, crepes, paninis or coffee. I ended up getting the Universes Favorite Challah French Toast and I have to say, I really loved it. Fresh fruit, great taste, reasonable price. They also give you the option of making your own if you want as well! Savory crepes that are of note include the Love Hate Thing and the Chicken & Gruyere Cheese with that lovely kick from the spicy sauce that they use on it (I only know from the recent Yelp Elite event). Sweet things of note include the Cheesecake Waffle and Nutella Classic. Their drinks here are also decent as well (I'm looking at you, coffee lovers). There's a decent amount of seating and the ambiance within is really warm and welcoming with tables of different sizes to accommodate different party needs (small/intimate to mid-size groups, maybe one large table in the back). It is worth paying a visit here ... you will not be disappointed!

dAX3HB8lzZSuz6OahS93Pg.text: Words cannot describe how delicious this place is. The venue is affordable. Eclectic, 1950s diner vibe, decor is adorable and comfortable. Lighting is great. hTDUJEAzSI7ZKpGDYPqihQ.text: Delicious crepes and great service, the only thing negative I can say is that I wish they were open earlier.

Kk3LO4mgzsktY8BChRNF-w.text: Crepes are one of my favorite breakfast/brunch items and I feel like there aren't enough places serving up crepes in Pittsburgh. I'm happy to see more are opening up, like this one! Geppetto Cafe is in the heart of Lawrenceville alongside all the other hip eateries. The environment is modern yet spunky.   My husband and I each got crepes (of course).  We decided to both choose from the savory variety; he got Ham and Cheese (Gruyere) while I got Prosciutto (with mozzarella). Both had a honey aioli, making them quite similar. Obviously the meats and cheeses were different but the flavor profile was the same, only the prosciutto was a bit more salty than the ham. I would say the honey aioli definitely took these crepes to another level. It added a sweetness that balanced the saltiness of meat and cheese while also adding a bit of moisture to cut the dryness of the crepe. The savory crepes came with a salad, which was a nice, fresh element.   The food, service, and decor were great. My only complaint (and it may be a bit nit picky) is the really strong smell of smoke or burnt food as soon as you step in. The grill is right at the entrance and while it is nice to see the folks prepare the food, the strong smell of smoke not only left me smelling like that the rest of the day, but it really irritated my asthma while I was there. Otherwise, I would definitely come back to try a sweet crepe and hope for a table outside!

Fib56Evq8H5KoBdcj6aoTg.text: I really wanted to like this place and sadly I was very disappointed. When trying to decide between a savory or sweet crepe I went with the bonjour savory crepe because it said "all savory crepes are served with a side salad". After waiting 40 minutes for our food to arrive we realized we had never received a side salad as the menu stated so I asked my waiter. He explained to me that the particular crepe I ordered comes with a side of fruit so they don't give you a side salad and apologized that their menu was confusing. I was a little irritated that I just waited 40 minutes for a crepe and you couldn't offer someone a side salad that your menu clearly states they get. On top of that they opened the back door right behind our table on a day it was 30 degrees so we had to rush to finish and pay our bill so we could leave because it was so cold.   I went here really thinking I would be coming back multiple times to try all of the different menu items I was interested in but I have to say after that experience I don't think I'll be returning.

ByuE6q9c1Ii6aZMFRs2Kig.text: I absolutely adore Geppetto Cafe. I have yet to have a bad experience there and I've been there on some of their busiest days (which are weekends, mind you).   The staff is ALWAYS nice and the crepes are always delicious. I recommend the Gone Fishin' crepe. I usually get mine without the cream cheese but instead, with honey aioli. The smoked salmon, caramelized onions, capers, and the sweet honey aioli really make for an AMAZING combination.  My partner usually makes his own crepe with fruit and Nutella. I love that there is the option to build your own or to pick from their specialty crepes and waffles!
